Description:
Responsibilities: Government RelationsEstablish and maintain positive relationships with government agencies, including labor departments and regulatory bodies.
Stay updated on labor laws, regulations, and compliance requirements and ensure the organization's HR practices align with them.
Coordinate and manage the process of obtaining necessary permits, licenses, and certifications as required by government authorities.
Serve as a liaison between the organization and government agencies, addressing any HR-related matters. Manpower Supplier ManagementCollaborate with manpower suppliers to ensure timely and efficient sourcing of temporary or contract workers.
Oversee the selection and onboarding process of manpower suppliers, ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures.
Monitor the performance and service quality of manpower suppliers, ensuring alignment with agreed-upon contractual terms.
Maintain accurate records of manpower supplier contracts, invoices, and related documentation. HR ComplianceEnsure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and reporting requirements, both locally and nationally.
Stay informed about changes in labor legislation and communicate updates to relevant stakeholders. Employee RelationsServe as a resource for employees, addressing questions, concerns, and conflicts.
Assist in resolving employee relations issues and mediating conflicts.
Provide guidance on employee disciplinary actions and performance improvement plans. HR Data Management and ReportingMaintain accurate employee records and HR information systems.
Ensure data privacy and security in accordance with applicable regulations. Employee Engagement and CultureSupport employee engagement initiatives, such as surveys, events, and recognition programs.
Contribute to fostering a positive work culture and promoting employee satisfaction.
Collaborate with management to address employee needs and improve employee experience. HR Projects and InitiativesParticipate in HR projects, such as policy updates, process improvements, and HR system implementations.
Stay updated on HR trends, best practices, and legal developments.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of HR programs and processes. Skills
